article: Carlos had been in New York for five months now , and he _ it . He would never forget the day when the plane landed . His parents had big smiles on their faces as they discussed the wonderful new life they would have in this great city . His older sister and brother looked in wonder and excitement at the buildings . Uncle Miguel and Aunt Esperanza thought of the good jobs they would get . Grandmother and Grandfather told him what a lucky boy he was to come to this wonderful city . But Carlos was lonely . The city looked big , cold and dirty to him . They lived in an apartment in Manhattan . There were stores and cinemas close to their home . But Carlos did n ' t want these things . He loved his home in the country in Puerto Rico ; he loved the green fields , the hot sun , and the lovely beaches . He did n ' t want to go to school because it made him think of his friends at home . And he did n ' t want to learn a new language that he could never describe the world as beautifully as his own . He began to go the dock , because this made him feel closer to Puerto Rico . He sat down and watched the ships . He would often find a man also sitting there looking at the sea . The man was Eric - - a taxi driver who came there to escape from the noisy traffic . Eric noticed the young boy and felt his sadness . One day he said , " Yes , it ' s hard to leave your homeland . I remember when I left Norway 15 years ago . I know it ' s hard to start a new life in a new country , but let ' s face it . I did it , and you can do it , too . " From then on the taxi driver and the young boy began to develop a deep friendship .
